website_summaries.verdict: One of the least expensive heat cables per foot that still gives you a nice level of performance.
pros: Ships with everything you need for an easy installation
Offered in lengths up to 200 feet, but even smaller lengths have a reasonable price per foot
Works on nearly any kind of roof or gutter material you'd commonly find
cons: Doesn't include a thermostat, so it will run continuously if it is plugged into an outlet

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with this...
customer_reviews.text: I plugged the wire in to make sure it wasn't DOA before I installed it. I left half of it unwound and it melted into a giant glob within about 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for my roof to help prevent ice damns. Went to install it, fairly easy installation even for a novice if you can read. Lesson learned though, plug it in before you install and make sure it works. It was junk right out of the box. Gatzies and Frost King would not honor the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Bought two and they saved my den.
customer_reviews.text: Water was coming in from an attic yesterday, we found the downspout that was clogged causing the leak. Some ice melt and LOTS of boiling water later we threaded this bad boy down it so it would never happen again. going to call the roofers in spring to find and seal out the roof at a non emergency price, but this line has made sure that the water is flowing smoothly to where it needs to go and not leaking in the our den. Other comments are about the power usage, defs put this on a timer or cold weather switch as it doesn't need to be on and eating your power bill 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: but until we come up with another solution (if there is one) it is better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: It was a little difficult ti get up but not insurrmountable. Husband installed in in a few hours. He said the clips were doable but not the strongest quality. They do work. Anyway when the weather got cold and it snowed it did the trick. We have it attached to a plug that automatically turns on and off dependint on the weather. Surprisingling enough it is February tomorrow and so far compared to the last few years it has been mild. After a few inches it may not be as effective, but until we come up with another solution (if there is one) it is better than nothing. Maybe now we can paint our living room after last winter's damage.
customer_reviews.author: Ita Sara

customer_reviews.title: Good at melting ice and power consumption is on spec
customer_reviews.text: I installed a 60 foot unit on the north side of the house. My only complaint is the clips are a bit flimsy, but I have tested the unit in the gutter and 60 foot cord will consume 300-330 watts of power. I am using a solar array and battery with an inverter to run the unit. Only had a chance to test melt a little ice in the gutter, but I could see it was quickly melting the ice. I assume I could technically install these in a small water tank for the dog/cat/horse too......
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: We live in Northern Michigan and get allot of snow and very very cold winters and we get ice build up in the gutters and these work perfect to keep the gutters clear.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit surprised to see that the heavy snow we received just after I installed the cables completely covered them, and it looked like they weren't doing anything. When I looked in from the end, however, I could see that there were tunnels in the snow around the wires, and the melt water was running along the wires into the gutter. I was skeptical that the recommended arrangement would keep the gutter and downspout free of ice, but it seems to work well. So far, it seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for 3 hours and they stopped working! Don’t buy this garbage! Really ticked that I ordered 2 of these and they gave out immediately!! These reviews are probably bogus/fake. I will never buy from frost king and make sure no one else does!! Ridiculous.....
customer_reviews.author: darrick

customer_reviews.title: Unconventional use, but water did not freeze.
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and packaged well. Used on 50 gal plastic drum for rain/snow melt water through the winter months. Worked like a charm wrapped around at 4" to 5" intervals and around the metal faucet, plugged into a thermo plug. On really cold days could still get water out of the barrel for my humidifier. Not the normal usage but it worked for me, my rain barrel did not freeze. I live in north central Arkansas.
customer_reviews.author: occasional shopper

customer_reviews.title: Can prevent ice dam damage if properly installed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the old cable heater, (exact same one) when it broke down last year. Not sure of the cause of it not working, but since it could have been my fault, I'll say no more about it. The installation of this one is a lot sturdier that the last, and although I haven't had to turn it on too much this winter, when I did turn it on, it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Beaucher

customer_reviews.title: Does the Trick!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely helps to prevent ice dams! The product is certainly most effective when you're diligent about it's use and not necessarily waiting until your roof is under ice for example, although it still works. While I am happy with the product if I did it again I may look for something with some additional safety features built in like an auto off or trip of some sort. Having a heated chord on my roof for hours, surrounded by water still makes me uneasy.
customer_reviews.author: J.Zim

customer_reviews.title: Can't use an extension cord!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to prevent an ice dam from forming on a section of my roof. Unfortunately the instructions say extension cords are not to be used with this product. So it is only effective for preventing ice dams near an outdoor outlet.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: These are working great. In typical fashion, we got slammed with snow early. This kept the roof pretty clear, so when we got a recent warm spell, there was no back-up of water from the ice. Don't know how its gonna impact the electric bill, but it will definitely alleviate the sore back from trying to hammer off the ice then trying to move it! Good for us old folks!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M. McNamara

customer_reviews.title: I laid it out in the gutter real easy with no problems.
customer_reviews.text: I have it installed in the long gutter and down each down spout a little ways. Can't say how well it works because the gutters have been ice free since I installed it. I'm sure it will work fine between the recommended temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: D. Darling

customer_reviews.title: Fragile, soft, easily damaged sheathing - unrepairable
customer_reviews.text: Realistically these cables are fragile and easy to damage. During installation the sheathing and the copper heating cable were damaged. Since they can't be repaired they became throwaway "lesson learned". Pay a little more and get the heavy duty, guaranteed for 4 years heating cable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael or Julieanne Greene

customer_reviews.title: Headache saver
customer_reviews.text: After the first year living in my house with ice dams and water building up so badly it would come in through the front window, this product has completely resolved the situation. Very easy to install and has saved me so many headaches. Even better it does not have a huge impact on my electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: It stopped the kids from playing hockey on my roof!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hey fellow roof dammers. This was fairly easy to install by reading the install guide and working with a helper (my dad). I had 160 ' and a bought a 60' section, which was longer than i needed but figured i could adjust. It worked out really well and did a great job of keeping up a recent 4" snowstorm. Ill update my review after seeing how it performs in a proper denver snowstorm.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy ...
customer_reviews.text: Will update after winter if problems So far so good great instructions , easy to install hope it works or helps with ice build up
customer_reviews.author: Teri Strandberg

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: easy install, good instructions, and it seems to be working, but i can feel it cooling off after its been on for a few hours. I'll rate it again in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. The instructions were clear and we had it installed in less than a half hour. We did have to take the down spouts apart in order to feed the wire through.We used zip ties to install in the main trough. It will be the first winter for the installation so we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: India

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: These are working great. In typical fashion, we got slammed with snow early. This kept the roof pretty clear, so when we got a recent warm spell, there was no back-up of water from the ice. Don't know how its gonna impact the electric bill, but it will definitely alleviate the sore back from trying to hammer off the ice then trying to move it! Good for us old folks!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M. McNamara

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Your zig-zag (triangle) configuration at the eve of the roof will take a lot of the length of the heat cable that you purchase. It seems better to have too much than too little heat cable. You might also need to purchase more clips (than come with the cable) to attach the cable to the roof shingles.
customer_reviews.author: Northender

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the price, Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help in keeping ice building up on my roof. I followed the installation instructions on the box and available on YouTube. it NEVER worked. the wire never heated up and melted nothing. I reached out the company to trouble shoot and they did not respond. In addition to not working at all the metal tabs that hold the wire to the shingles did a good amount of damage to the shingles when they were removed.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Harding

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Nice product & easy to install. The booklet gives you ideas on how to install for each particular problem with your roof. Very helpful! Works great too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerDianne

customer_reviews.title: Turns on itself at 32 degrees
customer_reviews.text: We had a frost king heat cord for 20 years and it worked great just received this one and we are waiting for snow to see if it works good as the other one
customer_reviews.author: Aretha Hodgkins

customer_reviews.title: works well for shingled roofs
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised for shingled roofs; not recommended for metal roofs as wires will actually keep the snow from sliding; clips are very light and don't work all that well; a product that can be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Works as heating rotator for water line
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the water lines on my Camper. Kept them thawed very nicely
customer_reviews.author: Pulga

customer_reviews.title: These deice cables work great
customer_reviews.text: These deicing cables work great. I've had one set going on 5 years and it's still working fine. I just bought two more, a 60' and an 80' The amazon price was much better than the local big box home store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, will have to wait for winter to see how well it controls ice buildup on the roof and gutters.
customer_reviews.author: Al1708

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This works very well and keeps my rain gutters from dripping when frozen.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff’s reviews

customer_reviews.title: works great no ice dams
customer_reviews.text: i put them a bit further up the roof just because. through the gutters and down the spout.
customer_reviews.author: dexter

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, exactly what I needed, and an excellent price. Not super-easy to install but hey, that is to be expected when dealing with roofs and gutters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't cover as much area as you might think.
customer_reviews.text: This kept the ice dam from forming all winter long. When installed according to directions, it will only cover about three feet of linear roofing space.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Ice didn’t overflow the gutter once this winter in Maine.used it in gutter and leader and no piles of ice at front door!
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm during last winter's 30 inch blizzard
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm during last winter's 30 inch blizzard. Just turn on when the snow starts and leave it on until the temp goes above 40
customer_reviews.author: Wanda the Honda

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Ice Melting Process
customer_reviews.text: This is the third property where we’ve elected to use this product. It is very durable and works extremely well . We would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: PaKakes

customer_reviews.title: Great for ice damns
customer_reviews.text: We got this for ice damns during a bad winter good investment for potential damage
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lisa Askew

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected. Remember to turn it on when ...
customer_reviews.text: Performs as expected. Remember to turn it on when the snow starts and turn it off when the temperature goes above 40!
customer_reviews.author: Wanda the Honda

customer_reviews.title: I lay this out on my patio with about 6 inches of ice the ice was gone in the morning👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿
customer_reviews.text: I lay this out on my patio with about 6 inches of ice the ice was gone in the morning
customer_reviews.author: idahomoemoscow

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up if you have a good ladder. Did a great job on our house.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Need more clips
customer_reviews.text: Hope this gets to manufacture. All looks good, but I only got 17 clips for a 60’ kit. Can I get more clips??
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2, only 1 is still working after minimal use.
customer_reviews.text: Only used off and on for 1 winter. Didn't leave it on, just plugged in and out as needed. 1 of the 2 that I purchased quit working and it's just the beginning of winter here in Wisconsin. Very disappointed in the quality for the price paid. Worked well but just didn't last for what you pay.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and a Horrible company to work with
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars, I would. First, the package came with missing shingle clamps. So as I was reading the installation instruction, all it said to do was attach to shingles, but gave no picture or way to do this. Second, the Vendor berated me for not doing my "homework" on this and not knowing the correct way to install it. Third then vendor called me a liar and cheat for telling them I was missing a part. I will never work with them again.
customer_reviews.author: user1000

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy, now time will tell if it works.
customer_reviews.author: Karaqueen

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: Not real heavy duty but does the job for a light snow
customer_reviews.author: Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Works but a little expensive to use
customer_reviews.text: Definitely kept our gutters ice free. Do be aware that you can expect a good $25 a month increase in your power bill though!
customer_reviews.author: V. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great light
customer_reviews.text: My boys loved their lite for their aquariums. I would buy again if I needed another light.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda  Roxbury

customer_reviews.title: It worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected. My old heat cable burned out mid winter and I had to make a switch after the ice dam was already in pace.
customer_reviews.author: D Ross Larson

customer_reviews.title: Reliable/easy to install
customer_reviews.text: A most reliable product. Merely follow the instructions/guidelines and you will be free of ice dams. This is my second purchase with my first kit (same length) still working. The fasteners to the roof shingle could be a bit more beefy/stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Heat tape review
customer_reviews.text: We use this heat tape in our sewer pipe, which runs under the driveway, to keep the pipe from freezing. Saves on big defrost bill.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: crappy product
customer_reviews.text: stay away from this... hard as hell to install and doesnt work anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Adamski

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased 2 sets, they worked very well so bought 1 more to finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Zarbolias

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price. Fast shipping too.
customer_reviews.text: Send a pry bar with the clips to get the shingles up enough for the clips to clip on. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Spectrel

customer_reviews.title: Its better than downtown ATM
customer_reviews.text: The over night is almost same day delivery very fast! There are no discounts for quantities. After order 50 to 60 I would think I would start seeing a wholesale price, or a sufficient knock down price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this thing will work great when we have a need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: When you live where you get several feet of snow and ice, it’s perfect
customer_reviews.author: teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Good Quality Products from Decker377
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ... easy to install. Good quality product. Also, the price is excellent. For similar products, the cost is twice the amount. I recommend that you stay with Decker377 as an Amazon Vendor. Would buy again for such an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Yelmottob

customer_reviews.title: As advertised. Haven't had a use for it yet ...
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Haven't had a use for it yet, but did install it.
customer_reviews.author: BillyBob Rochester Ny

customer_reviews.title: Good value for your money.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Works great so far. Will update after the winter. Plenty of hardware to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: joseph jennings

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this stuff works and is super affordable, easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used in garden
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a heater in my hoop house garden, worked wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bough 2 boxes for the price of one from the local store
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Unfroze Water Pipes!
customer_reviews.text: We used this as heat tape for our water pipes. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: lennbulld

customer_reviews.title: Bottom shelf
customer_reviews.text: Worked great when I first installed but Quit working in a month and a half... do it once and buy a quality product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great keeps ice buildup out of gutter. Installed on top of gutter leaf guard.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Stanovich

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My gutters have been ice dam free since installing this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Winter Review
customer_reviews.text: Funny thing to review this , in June, but it did do a good job back in March
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: It worked great! The clips were a bit weak but it ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great! The clips were a bit weak but it melts nice channels to allow the water to get off the roof instead of backing up into the house.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised. Installed before last snow storm, and the wire definitely prevented the ice dams we normally get from forming. Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne M Radziewicz

customer_reviews.title: Most major stores like Home Depoe
customer_reviews.text: Most major stores like Home Depoe , and Lowes in my area do not carry this item Its the perfect product to stop your gutters and down spouts from freezing
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Welsh

customer_reviews.title: These roof edge kits are great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These roof edge kits are great for the price, you can't beat them. I had some working for five years and still working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did not fix all the problems but definitely helped a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Mckinney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Highly recommend it. We plug and unplug it when we know a storm is coming and so far this season, hasn't failed us.
customer_reviews.author: R.R.

customer_reviews.title: Greeat product
customer_reviews.text: This de-icing cable works great and it has taken care of my icing problem. I would purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Finally a DYI that worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: Use the Frost King on my deck that has a ceiling beneath it and a patio. removes Minnesota's snow and keep the deck floor fairly clean for the platform bird feeders. Snow melts and then goes between the deck boards and onto the ceiling, then to the gutter and gone.
customer_reviews.author: bojo360

customer_reviews.title: Got here just in time.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed. I had ice dams building up on my house and needed them gone before my roof suffered damages. This worked perfectly and now my eaves are clear. I know they are for prevention and not remediation but worked great. They are now installed according to instructions and are working great. The heating cable is 300w and not 500w as stated. Since it works great I didnt mind, plus it saves on electric bills.
customer_reviews.author: Average man

customer_reviews.title: This product will save time and money.
customer_reviews.text: After spending $629.00 to have a drain pipe cleared of ice I purchased the Frost King. I placed the cable down the drain pipe and no more freezing. Safe, nice quality, several ways to use the product. It doesn't trip breakers like one I purchased from a local hardware store. Buy it before next winter and no more frozen gutters or downspouts.
customer_reviews.author: MollyJ57

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the winter of 2016-2017. They did not work, either of them! Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: rebecca s.

customer_reviews.title: I have installed the 100' cable and am waiting for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have installed the 100' cable and am waiting for the first snow to try it out. It takes a lot more cable than you think. I had bought a 60' and it wasn't close to meeting my needs. So really measure well the length of the gutter and how much cable is going to be needed for the roof. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sturman

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: It did not work. I did not test it before putting it up on the roof. Now that it is snowy and cold, I tried to use it and it does not work. I am not happy about that. Amazon did credit my account the the amount spent on this defective product. Kudos to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: tshef

customer_reviews.title: The wires cant touch each other, and cant be ...
customer_reviews.text: The wires cant touch each other, and cant be put on existing ice. Only for the fall before the ice starts. FYI.
customer_reviews.author: D. M.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: a piece of trash, threw it out after a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works as expected--replaced old frost king cables that quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Traviglia

customer_reviews.title: Save your gutters and roof.
customer_reviews.text: I live in NE Ohio by Lake Erie, these are mandatory to keep ice dams off my shingles. I love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. McDonough

customer_reviews.title: The thermostat is the other bad point. It won't work unless the gutter has ...
customer_reviews.text: With no winter weather this year. The product hasn't worked. Two, things, the clips are to soft, that attach it. The thermostat is the other bad point. It won't work unless the gutter has enough water in it to activate it. If it isn't on, it won't melt the snow to cause water to be in the gutter.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Karpinski

customer_reviews.title: looks like it will be fine
customer_reviews.text: Have not set it up yet. looks like it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, only 4 stars because haven't used them as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: pops

customer_reviews.title: Needs "What's included".
customer_reviews.text: This gets a three because the packaging did not say it included clips. So I bought clips and they were not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Heat from cable way too low to melt snow and ice
customer_reviews.text: Installed the heat cable and the first snow it would not melt snow past a 1" distance from the cable. Inside the gutter it would not melt the snow enough to keep from freezing. I felt the cable after being powered up for more than 24 hours and it was barely warm.
customer_reviews.author: Linwood Head

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: we have had no snow since I bought it so I really can,t give you a review
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no iceing
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be doing a good job, as it is meant for.
customer_reviews.author: Cleo H. Kain

product_meta.title: Frost King RC60 Heating Cables, 60', Black
product_meta.description: Style:60 FeetFrost King roof and gutter cables. Prevents ice build up in gutters and ice dams getting under the shingles. Kit comes complete with cable spacers and shingle clips. Complete installation instructions. Available in lengths from 30' - 200'.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars366 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
